question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Shard Failure] If a shard crashes or becomes unresponsive while global transactions are waiting for cross-shard data, does the global executor timeout or hang indefinitely causing loss of liveness? (High)

(Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Concurrency Override] The BlockExecutorLocalConfig uses default_with_concurrency_level() on line 63 - can this be manipulated to use concurrency levels that don't match available threads, causing performance issues or deadlocks? (Medium)

(Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: new()] [Thread Count Validation] The num_threads parameter has no validation - can passing 0 cause division by zero or other errors in downstream code that assumes positive thread counts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Config Inconsistency] The local config is created fresh each time while onchain_config is passed in - can inconsistencies between these configs cause execution divergence across validators?
